attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Section 36 of the Trade Description Act 1968 allows the country of origin of food to be labelled as British, on the condition that it has undergone sufficient change in the U.K e.g packed, cooked, cured in the U.K. This legislation is misleading Consumers, undermining the high standards of British Agriculture and allows retailers and processors the freedom to label foreign products as British.
